alert.note: Alert for Crockett (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 24 at 8:34AM CDT until March 24 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FOR MOST OF WEST CENTRAL TEXAS FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING FOR VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES AND GUSTY WEST WINDS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES AND STRONG WEST WINDS FOR CROCKETT COUNTY... The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a Red Flag Warning for critical fire weather conditions, which is in effect from 1 PM this afternoon to 9 PM CDT this evening. * WINDS...West 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 percent. * FUELS...Normal * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly. Any outdoor activity that could produce flames or sparks is discouraged.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will occur shortly. A combination of strong winds, low humidity and dry fuels will contribute to extreme fire behavior.
